snippet: Despite deepening doubts over a proposed high-speed rail that would connect San Francisco and Los Angeles, legislators narrowly approved spending $8 billion to start construction.
abstract: California State Senate narrowly approves legislation to spend $8 billion in federal and state money to begin construction of a $70 billion high-speed rail system, despite deepening doubts about the cost and feasibility of the project.
lead_paragraph: Despite deepening doubts over a proposed high-speed rail that would connect San Francisco and Los Angeles, legislators narrowly approved spending $8 billion to start construction.

headline.seo: California Senate Narrowly Approves Rail Project
headline.main: Lawmakers Vote to Move Ahead With California Rail Link
headline.print_headline: Rail Project Is Approved In California
